Reviews.Title: “Quaint and intresting”
Reviews.Author: adrianrelward
Reviews.Content: Left out of front door 200 mts up road 200 mts down next one and you face the Blue Mosque what more could you want, a great hotel, well at Divas you have the lot, Not an International pristine block but a real hotel with twists and turns a great little garden seating area,We are here at the moment (24 April) and looking across the Bosporus at the shipping and views of the city to the water,we are in a room at the top of the rear block Haghia Sophia room. Enough said come and try...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LuvMorocco
Reviews.Content: Hotel Divas is first and foremost located within an easy walking distance to most sights in Istanbul and well as many excellent restaurants. It is located in the historic district. Istanbul is built on hills and the return to the hotel is up hill. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to assist in many ways. The breakfast included in the room price was an abundance of food that was not only filing but a pleasure to the senses. I stayed on two occasions. My room on both occasions was small but perfectly adequate. Plenty of hot water. Complimentary coffee and tea in the room. There was a balcony over looking the sea. There is no elevator from the first to second floor but is available to all remaining floors. An excellent choice and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staying.”
Reviews.Author: Dana D
Reviews.Content: Excellent conditions. Clean rooms and the personnel is very kind and at your disposition all time. Very near down down with excellent prices for the location and the quality of the services.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and service”
Reviews.Author: M_Xastre
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, the breakfast is excellent, and the staff is very helpful. A especial thank you to Mehmet and Kenas for the excellent service and their sympathy. MX

Reviews.Title: “More like 2 star than 4”
Reviews.Author: Richard1505
Reviews.Content: Bedrooms very small, insist on sea view third floor or above. Breakfast very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Shinny303197
Reviews.Content: Romms are exelent.We had american breakfast-everything was tasty.Near the hotel u can visit many important buildings.Near is also Grand Bazaar.Persons from the reception were very kind.Fuat from the receptionn explained us everything we wanted,he was so kind.So I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ismailov
Reviews.Content: We two friends from Azerbaijan spent four days in this hotel, which is situated in the oldest and longest inhabited part of Istanbul - Sultanahmet. It takes only a few minutes from this hotel to historical places. The hotel staff are very kind and helpful. Especially, we remember Mustapha (from breakfast area), who is an extraordinarily polite man. Rooms are of good size and quite comfortable. They are also clean and tidy. Thanks to the cosiness of the hotel, we got a great pleasure from staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Botique hotel tucked in the old town”
Reviews.Author: albertyong88
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the quiet area of Istanbul. Only minutes away from the main attraction (Blue Mosque) ... You will hear public chanting in the early hours as well as through out the day as there is a mosque pretty close to the hotel. Neighbourhood is friendly, and it's the area where locals live. Vehicle access is very difficult as roads are narrow, and ordering taxis could be a while (due to constant traffic jam) ... Free internet is a plus, and variety of Turkish buffet breakfast. Room is clean, and comfortable. Air conditioned as well (if you need it) Overall is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nazeera from South Africa”
Reviews.Author: Nazeera K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Diva's hotel and i must say the service received was exceptional. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. They will go out of their way to make your stay at Diva's hotel memorable. I would personal like to Thank Hikmet and Turkan front desk for always being so welcoming, Ibrahim and Fuat who would go out of their way to help you with any problems you have in your room, Mustapha (Dining area) he always made sure the place was clean and you were never short of breakfast and he was so helpful... he knew how i liked hot milk and he made sure that there was enough and to Hokan (Cleaning staff) for keeping my room clean and was accommodating with my times. Plus the hotel is centrally located and its within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Haga Sophia, Topkapi Place and all the eating areas. And if you have a room with the Balcony then the scenery is stunning. It overlooks 1 of the Mosques as well as the Ocean. It is so relaxing to just sit on the Balcony looking at the ships coming and going. Once again thanks for the warm welcome and the amazing memories of being in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Jose Manuel S
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, well located (5 min. walk from Sultanahmet and blue mosque), excellent service (specially day staff), carefull and nice decoration, little kitsch, though. Rooms of good size, comfortable, and with excellent views for those oriented to port. Avoid rooms near reception hall. Breakfast buffet quite complete and good quality. Salons inside and outside. Restaurant and activities recommendations little expensive, better look independently.

Reviews.Title: “Grateful!”
Reviews.Author: Gami L
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the smile you gave us every morning and evening, for the best room with an incredible view, for the comfort to go all around. I`ll be back when the tulips bloom to have a turkish coffe on a terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Honey Moon”
Reviews.Author: Murtaza J
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing experience and the staff at Diva's made us feel right at home, we'll never forget that we started our new life at Diva's, I would recommend it to every one visiting Turkey. loved the buffet breakfast! Thank you Divas.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucKaK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Diva's Hotel. Why I rate this hotel that low? Because something was STOLEN from my room, so that is why I said AVOID this hotel. Hotel was ok for short break, brekfast same every day, but if u went there just for weekend, it was ok. Linen was stained with blood. Only good thing about this hotel was the location, nearly all main attractions were within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Great views and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kathzeem
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel in the heart of the old city, with great views over the town and the Sea of Marmaris. Close to the sights, good restaurants and the Grand Bazaar, and just a few minutes away from the tram stop, making the journey from the airport really easy. Our room was lovely and warm, even though the temperature was colder than in Scotland. The shower was excellent, very hot and powerful, even though we were on the top floor. Liked the Turkish breakfast, especially the cheese pastries. An lovely introduction to Istanbul. Many thanks to Hikmet and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and super service”
Reviews.Author: Rahime H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 night with my father...The rooms was very clean every day...The breakfast good.The stuff was very helpful and friendly especially Mehmet did his best for our comfort (Thanks him). We were very satisfied of service...I advice everybody this hotel and the place is wonderful because all sightseeings are around there...Enjoy your travel

Reviews.Title: “''Great Staff and Locationâ€�”
Reviews.Author: mary m
Reviews.Content: Great Staff and Locationâ€� The location is TOPS, close to everything! Very friendly, laid-back staff and management. There were only 2 rooms per floor,... We would recommend a room at the back of the hotel on the fifth floor with its magnificent view at night of the marmara sea.I'd stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and very reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie Z
Reviews.Content: We spent six days visiting Istanbul and were very comfortable and well-looked after at Diva's Hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance of all of the key sites, as well as near the tram for trips further afield. The rooms were well-equipped and the beds were comfortable The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful, expecially Mehmet and Ibrahim. The breakfast was substantial and varied and provided a good meal to start the day. We had a great view from our balcony. The hotel was also very clean. I would definitely recommend this to friends and family visiting Istanbul and would return to Diva's if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Customer care is the name of their game”
Reviews.Author: kjbarnett
Reviews.Content: During our four night stay, all staff could not have been more caring or attentive. We really enjoyed our stay. We also had difficulty locating Diva's Hotel when we first arrived. - it is very close to Sokollu Mehmet Pasa Mosque

Reviews.Title: “hotel divas”
Reviews.Author: VASILEIOS K
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and confortable place to stay .the staff is very friendly and kind the room has a very nice view and the location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good value”
Reviews.Author: MandJNottingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel puts you right at the heart of things, all the major sight were just an easy walk away. Clean, warm rooms - my stay was in Feb and it was cold outside. The beds were firm and comfortable, the shower worked perfectly and the TV had English news channels. Breakfast was fairly basic but the bread was fresh and the coffee was good - a little more fruit would have been nice however. Staff were always on hand and always very helpful. The room size was fine but the lounge in the foyer area was a little small. Overall and given the price - a very good value hotel if you are looking for a central Sultanahmet experience.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Ant B
Reviews.Content: First of all, Istanbul is a beautiful city with wonderful people. I have to come back. But I will look for another hotel. This one has smelly rooms, and not very clean. Bathrooms smell like rotten drains, the hairdryer never worked. Great location though. Yes, you got to climb up a little to get to it, but this is Istanbul, not New York. Most everybody in the hotel spoke poor English: they said yes to everything, but you could tell they were not understanding a word. It took them three days to fix the fridge in the bedroom, though they always said it would be fixed by the time we got back from our daily trips. Breakfast was very cheap. Rooms were kind of small, not all have a pretty view. I actually saw 3 different rooms: one of them was very noisy, the other facing an inside patio, the third had a good view though. Elevator is scaaaary, I got trapped in it the very first night, and the only thing the staff member kept saying was: "Not good, not good". It is a cheap hotel, the staff is nice, but not very helpful. Istanbul and its people are magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: jean s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the main area and so close the every domestic places ( hipodrom, topkapi palace, hagia sophia, blue mosque etc. ) the staff was so friendly and helpful they tried to make their best for any kind of my questionsWe highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is a budget traveler who appreciates excellent service and location., thanks for all.

Reviews.Title: “please please please DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: lancashire123
Reviews.Content: 1) Poor location, very hard to find, you must be Olympic athlete to climb streets up and down. 2) Rude day time and evening staff at reception. 3) No guests allowed in room at any time, my brother came to visit me during day time and he had to pay 20euros to come to room just to pick few things from my room, this is shambles and day light robbery. 4) Very limited selection of food at breakfast, no juices, only juice drink full of sugar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tania v
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel well location.the Hotel was very clean.breakfast buffet was very good.you can see all of The Marmara sea from balkony.front desk friendly And polite.there was a beautiful garden to take coffee in the evening.we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: david d
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Blue Mosque, Hafia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market, this hotel is in an excellent location for touring the city. Very friendly staff and nice rooms. Good breakfast and all very clean and well .The receptionist was very helpfull they advised us many city trips and bosphorus cruise we really enjoyed with all of them.We highly reccomend this hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “â€œExcellent Turkish hospitality at an excellent hotel.â€�)”
Reviews.Author: PauloBenito
Reviews.Content: We have been in the hotel 3 nights, it was a really good experience, the hotel's location was super. Not least the staff was very helpful and smiling, especially Hikmet .Fuat , Mehmet. Can definitely recommend the hotel if you want a wonderful experience in Istanbul. Location - perfect! very a quiet street! 10minutes walking distance from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace...Hospitality - perfect! True Turkish hospitality shown from the moment you walk through the door.

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat location, very helpful, lovely hotelâ€�”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahVakkas
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lot during my stay in the hotel, Staff is very kind to us, we feel like a family, everything is best, the tradiotional buffet breakfast was exellant, the pickup and drop service was very good and punctual, we feel secure, free wifi, Tea and coffee making facilities, Neat & clean rooms and floor, all main tourism sites are very nearby walking distance like Topkapi, Sultan Ahmet Mosque, Grand bazar. Great staff welcoming you with a smile at all times and give all kind of guidence you need, In my opinion everything was exellent and hope again stay with the same hotel and recomend to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DwaynePaul
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with our stay at the Diva's Hotel.The rooms were clean.The bathroom was good, the shower was great.The staff was very nice and helpful.I would go back there again. Thanks for you have done everything :)) Thanks Diva's Hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: mostafa d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location, blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaar and islamic art musuem are in walking distance. The tram station is also near by... loved the hotel stay it was awesome we had hot water running all time, staff's were friendly and the breakfast was great to get you going till lunch. Many restaurants close by so if you are foodie you will love it... Thank you Diva's Hotel and specially Kazim for all the help and for recommending the boat tour it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Mgreeff
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with hotel. Not in fun area, a bit out of main drag. Rooms were below average and bedspreads dirty. Bathroom tiny and toilets leaked out bottom and we never had warm let alone hot water for shower. Breakfast really cheap quality and garden area very very tired. Not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and nice hotel in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Marino_MFribourg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a twin room on the 6th floor with a superb view on Marmara and the Sokulla Mehmet Pascha Camii. The hotel is in a quiet area, very central and some minutes from Hagia Sophia etc. Breakfast was excellent and the manager as well as the whole staff very friendly and helpful (e.g. Mehmet, Ibrahim and Hikmet at the desk).

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Glenyce M
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be poor, difficult to find, up a winding steep hill; the internet was very iffy, and the hotel was very noisy. We stayed on the ground floor, could hear everything going on above us and around us. Our toilet leaked from the base for the three nights we were there. We must have reported it 4-5 times with no action. The floor was always flooded in the bathroom and slippery. The room was large and cleran, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: EvaMila
Reviews.Content: I have just spend 6 nights at this nice and quiet hotel. I go to Istanbul every year in October with a group of students and I always stay at Divas. The hotel is located in a small street hardly without any traffic. Its a 5 - 7 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. I stayed in a room on the 4th floor with a wonderful view over the Marmara sea. The room was clean and even if the bathroom was small, it was well functioned. The breakfeast is good. The hotel has a very nice patio for warm nights. The staff at the hotel are one of the reasons why I keep comming back. If you behave as one should expect from any costumer, namely calm and polite, you will find yourself surrounded by very nice people. This is a family friendly hotel and not a place to party. I can strongly recommend this hotel and I know for sure that I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “best value best service”
Reviews.Author: sonia h
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, is closed to all the historical sightseeings just around the corner you find Hagja Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Services are good and people are kind, we spent a great time there. The receptionist is very polite and breakfast is very good. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful ending to a wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: colleenct
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Stayed for 2 nights. Water was cold in shower on both days. Toilet leaked water (I hope!) constantly so you stood in it everytime you entered the smallest bathroom. The taps were loose on the basin. The throw on the bed had stains on it. The bar fridge was not re-stocked. We were 3 people in one room but they only supplied cups, etc for 2. The breakfast was awful. The "fruit" juice is a cordial mixed with water and it does not get refridgerated. Just stood there for the 2 days we were there. It may be close to the sights such as Blue Mosque but it is in a "dead" area where you do not feel like walking around at night as you are unsure how safe you are or where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest shower door in the world?”
Reviews.Author: OzTravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: To be fair we were booked into another hotel nearby and had to spend our first night in Istanbul in this hotel unexpectedly. That being said, I suggest you ask the booking manager to check if both doors of the shower will open fully. After an exhausting flight we collapsed into bed and awoke because of the noise and stuffiness of the room. On attempting to have a shower in the morning neither my wife nor me could get into the shower! Now I'm about average size and my wife is small, but when one dorr opens up hard onto a wash basin and the other opens about 60 degrees this leaves a gap about 6 inches wide to squeeze by to have a shower. We gave up. The bed was tiny, there was no double glazed windows to stop noise from outside, the AC was noisy and we blew a fuse as soon as we tried to make a hot drink. Breakfast was poor and minimal. We were glad to leave but we were worried about the one we were then going to. Luckily that next one was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: sallyberry
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to istanbul to a wedding. We were advised to get a hotel near Sultanhamet (Blue Mosque, Cistern, Hagia Sophia, etc.) as that is where most of the tourist activities are. This hotel was reasonably priced, had twin beds, great wifi, free) a safe, refrigerator and a "sea view". The room was small, the patio small, bathroom small, but spotlessly clean and updated. The breakfasts in the patio were great too! We could walk to the tourist areas and an easy walk to the Metro. Lots of small restaurants in the area. Very helpful staff at all times. Go there and stay, have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: maizemiller2003
Reviews.Content: staff unfriendly - was it because of Ramadan ?? I booked by using their website and paid 20 Euros more than my collegues who had booked through a travel agency -??????

Reviews.Title: “I shall come here again”
Reviews.Author: anar_302
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel,very nice clean,very friendly staff especially Fuat,Mehmet,Kazim,Yasin,Ibrahim ALL SUPER

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: hasse-min-hasse
Reviews.Content: I donÂ´t have any complaints at all, everything was perfect, bedrooms, breakfast, the stuff, their personality and especially their expertise in Istanbul. I could ask everything and they had answer about everything. They could help me plan on how I should visit places and every night my turkish tea was ready, they knew exactly how I wanted it. I truly recommend this hotel again, because they areÂ´nt like hotel stuff they are more like a family...

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel in the old center”
Reviews.Author: chombica
Reviews.Content: Friend and I had 5 nice days in Istanbul. The organisation of the airport transfer was well organised, thanks for the gratis one way ride! the hotel is cosy, 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, room clean, nice decorated.The only minus were the construction works just opposite the hotel, but they should be finished soon - hope : - )))) after the whole day of sightseeing , shopping we slept well desoite that and the prayer call from the nearby mosque. recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Maja_Duka
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time at Diva's hotel. Rooms and bathroom are very clean, cozy and well equipped, staff is great-really pleasent and helpful. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Diva's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaeps
Reviews.Content: I stayed there myself and spent great time.Diva's is fantastic with its polite staff and delicious breakfast.Receptionists are so effective and heplful,they are ready to help you whenever you need.Location is pretty good.Easy access to main places.Definetely good choosing ..

Reviews.Title: “great place, great staff, great service”
Reviews.Author: nes12
Reviews.Content: i just got back from a 4 day trip from istanbul, and had stayed in Divas' hotel, clean rooms, very nice staff, they are always there to assist you in everythng.. and also the location is great its near to every nice places in the city..i will love to come back in istanbul and will stay in divas again... :)

Reviews.Title: “your cacoon in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alia98
Reviews.Content: had an amazing stay in Istanbul at Diva's Hotel, its located in a very quite neighborhood, my room was located on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking a panoramic view of the mermera sea and a spectacular mosuqe, the view is just hipnotic especialy sun rise and sun set time :) breakfast is served in a cute garden outside and inside also, bathroom clean, walls are a bit thin i must say :) the staf were very friendly and extremely helpfull, Diva's is only a 3 minute walk uphill to the nearest Tram station ! perfect if you plan on allot of shopping at the grand bazar ! enjoy ur stay

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: danzell
Reviews.Content: The staff were pleasant and responsive - service was attentive without being intrusive.Attractive decor, in keeping with the theme of the hotel. The room was a good size with a large en suite, although this does vary from room to room. The beds were comfy and the room was well supplied with the high quality basics. If you are a light sleeper, take some ear plugs to counteract the noisy plumbing and creaky floorboards - inevitable in an older hotel and our only minor criticism.Divas certainly stands out above them in both style and service. We would definitely go again and would recommend it to friends.However Very impressed and pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “DivaÂ´s Hotel is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Suara81
Reviews.Content: I was with friends in April for two weeks in diva's hotel, we felt really at home, the rooms were very nice, the staff was very very nice, friendly helpful and have shown very impressive hospitality. The food was delicious .. Diva's Hotel is highly recommended. In my next holiday I would also like to stay in Diva's Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice small cozy hotel- would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cm74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over Easter period with friends for a total of 5 nights , triple room consisted of a double bed + a single bed. Would have prefered 3 single beds as we were 3 friends but the room was nice and spacious with view to a small patio and a Mosque, so not a problem. Breakfast was okay, coukd have had a bit more variety but there were enough things to have a nice breakfast and keep you going through the morning. bread was amazing. Hotel location is good, less than 10 minutes walking from Blue Mosque, the streets are quite hilly but there are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. We returned very late to the hotel most days and found streets and area safe.hotel staff were very helpful when we requested help to reconfirm the tour we had booked. I would stay again in this hotel. CM

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant environment and excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Jnas1
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to walk and go up and Down hills to get there. Reasonably close to sultanamet highlights.

Reviews.Title: “All is very well except sleep”
Reviews.Author: k-s-2011
Reviews.Content: Plus: location, service, helpful staff, nice and clean rooms, free Wi-Fi. Minus: walls and doors are very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Iceandfewer
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to accomadate in Diva's Hotel.Everything was wonderful.Staff were so polite and breakfast was delicious.It was close to historical moniments.Location was very nice.Price was little high but It was worth it.I certainly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spending great time in Diva's Hotel..:)))”
Reviews.Author: Nietzche
Reviews.Content: I am an exchange student in Turkey ,and I wanted to spend my three days for a small vacation in Istanbul.Although there are a lot of hotels for choosing in Istanbul,I was so anxious for my accomadation.I found out this hotel on the internet and liked it so much.It's so close to historical articles such as Blue Mosque,Grand Bazaar,Santa Sophia and takes only 10 minutes to vehicles such as tram,bus etc.Staff are so polite especially, receptionists and one of the waiters called Fuat are ready to help you whenever you need.Thanks guys for your great hospitality.If you want to taste the hospiatality of turks,I definetely reccomend you to stay in Diva's hotel.:)))Lastly,breakfast was so delicious and made me feel like being in my house.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, my stay was very comfortable:))”
Reviews.Author: addy3174
Reviews.Content: I generally give very little time and ask for room, as i like this hotel, and whenever i came istanbul i stayed in this hotel only, because of friendly staff, very helpful and over all a very decent ambience, So despites of such a short notice Ms Sidar always finds something for me :) thats so nice of her, and that too at some best price, So I recommend all to try atleast once this hotel:) Hikmet and his other collegues were really nice for my any needs, So I wish all the best to Sidar and the entire team of Divas Hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Service & quality, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: macbeco
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after backpacking through Mongolia & Russia. Staff very attentive and helpful. Hotel clean everywhere. Breakfast large. everything was very pleasant I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Old City”
Reviews.Author: globalnole
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Istanbul in Feb 2011 and stayed at Diva's. For â‚¬55 a night in the off-season, it was a good hotel. The staff were friendly, not particularly attentive or negligent. The location is on a side street near the Blue Mosque, about a five minute walk away. Since it was the off-season, they gave us a choice of rooms. I was disappointed with the view, was expecting a sea view, but instead had a view of a nice alley. My partner wanted that room instead, why I don't know. We were on the third floor and had to close the window at night because it was quite loud with cars or people as well as the call to prayer at 5am. Otherwise, a good value hotel in a good location. The rooms are a little small, or cozy as one would say. And there was a slight smell of mold in the bathroom, but no visible signs anyway. Fixtures were nice as well. If you stay for three nights or more, they'll send a car service to pick you up from the hotel, which was useful, efficient and free! They also arrange for â‚¬5 a shuttle service back to the airport, which will pick up others along the way. If I had my pick again, I would stay here, but would also consider going to Beyoglu to be closer to nightlife and what not. Overall, a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: svea009
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with exellent location but You need healthy sceleton, it isa hilly area. Yoy wake up to the prayers, the bathrooms are very small

Reviews.Title: “Feel like your home”
Reviews.Author: thomas200411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Divas hotel early January. We really appreciated this very nice and cosy hotel located in the heart of the old city close by the Sultanahmet mosque. We felt like being at home. We particularly appreciated the warm welcome by the front desk employees and more specifically by Mr. Hikmet. He was very attentive towards us. He transmitted us his passion of the city and was of help in the choice of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ssuantwo
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly on arrival. Room clean and well decorated. Contintental breakfast was excellent with large choice. Location is absolutely brilliant 5 mins walk to blue mosque. We never used a taxi as 5 mins walk, ( unfortunately up a steep hill ) takes you to the trams. Due to the hill I would not recommend this hotel for prams or people with walking disabilities

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with very good service in a fantastik location.”
Reviews.Author: joseff11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location with very good service and all amenities. Most historic sites are within walking distance of the hotel and a tram is 3 minutes walk away for anything that is not, or if you've walked your feet off. Our room was with marmara sea view and balcony.We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Bank claims my money back”
Reviews.Author: Daisychain18
Reviews.Content: My bank had to seize back over Â£200 from this hotel. I never stayed there and their reason for charging for 2 nights stay was a total fabrication. My advice is to never give your credit card number to this hotel - even via a booking company. They overbooked our superior room with a view and then tried to make us stay in very substandard accommodation in a dirty,dark and poor condition basement room in another hotel whilst we were still expected to pay their own much higher prices . I consider the management of this hotel totally unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Like your home !!!”
Reviews.Author: arkantos325
Reviews.Content: simple, comfortable, clean, friendly staff. central location. affordable prices. I would recommend to anyone. feel at your home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent view”
Reviews.Author: Aparneknut
Reviews.Content: Good service and overall a nice hotell. Excellent location and amazing view from the balcony of most of the rooms. Clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: David_Lewis0
Reviews.Content: First of all the location of the hotel was excellent, it's within walking distance to the Blue mosque and other historical buildings such as the Hagia sophia, it is true that the Hotel is located on a hill, but in my experience, when travelling in istanbul you will be walking up and down hills every where wheather you like it or not, it's simply istanbuls geographic state. The rooms were clean and staff were excellent and friendly, and as the hotel isn't located on the main street a quite night was a given, we also had an excellent view over looking the bosphorus. Overall I feel that Divas Hotel was and excellent place to stay, it's affordable, comfortable, has friendly staff and is in very close proximaty of historical buildings and places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean hotel, rude guy at the reception”
Reviews.Author: M_and_FT
Reviews.Content: The hotel and our room were very clean. Not big, but very clean. Breakfast was good. I wasnâ€™t very happy with the guy at the reception desk, despite his good English: he said hello, then he took our passports, and let us wait and wait while he was talking over the phone. He was playing with our passports in a careless manner, and when I ask him to stop he became rude. He did inform us about all the different activities and tours that they have deals with without asking if we need that information. These activities were very pricey. Then, he made us wait even longer because the room wasnâ€™t readyâ€¦ The hotel was hard to find, even for the taxi driver. However, it is situated downtown, and all turistic destinations are easy to reach from tis point.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cute and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ajan2010
Reviews.Content: Very cute boutique hotel in Sultanahmet area, just 10mins walking distance from all important sights. The hotel, our room and the dining area were very clean. We had a beautiful view of the Mehmet Pasha mosque and the Marmara sea. Breakfast was good, tasty and healthy, and as long as you made it down early enough there was plenty of food to eat. The staff was friendly especially maids and the waiting stuff at the breakfast. A few drawbacks we encountered were: - poor English skills of the staff working at the hotel especially reception - two days we ran out of hot water and had to shower with cold water only - only one key was given for the room and the key was required for electricity, so we could never seperate - the staff didn't inform us of the shuttle service to the airport, so we booked it through another hotel in the vicinity. however they did inform us as soon as we landed which was quiet late in the evening about all the different activities and tours that they have deals with (none the less very pricey deals...) I'd recommend the hotel to others, but if I were to go to Istanbul again I'd stay somewhere else just to experience different area.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for all the major Tourist Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Dennis49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one week with my teenage son in a room with 2 single beds. Room 404 has sea views. Staff: Friendly, polite and helpful. Room: Compact, comfortable, clean and tidy. Breakfast: Buffet style, sufficient and enjoyable. Location: First Class - save money on not having to travel to major tourist attractions, eveything is only 10 to 15 minutes walk.. Istanbul is a 24X7 city. You'll love it. Stay at this hotel it's more than adequate. Free WiFi in the rooms enable you to keep in touch with email, do flight online check-in and search attractions. No hot water on 2 mornings running but it was swiftly rectified by the evening. YES, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the most horrible Hotel we ever see”
Reviews.Author: AMB84
Reviews.Content: The Terrible Hotel in Divas in Old Site we Surprised about the Rooms (Clean, Service, attitude...) Everything There is a Woman Called Sidar i think it's a Marketing Manager , but her Behavior you can't imagine how much is worse ,we couldn't stay just 1 night so never reserve in this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: susantnqueen
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was wonderful - friendly, helpful, and accommodating. My room was small, but clean, in good condition, nicely decorated, with private bath and air conditioning - everything I needed. The hotel is walking distance to many key sites I wanted to visit. The only negative is that the location was a bit hard to find...even for taxi drivers. I ended up drawing my own map with some landmarks to make it easy to find. Overall, I think the hotel was a great value and was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: audycalifornia
Reviews.Content: In reading other reviews I have to say that yes the rooms are small but we had a beautifu view looking at the Bosphorus in the distance and out over the Mosques. The beds are comfortable and the room was very clean. The staff were wonderful and helpful, particularly Sidar Cetin who I communicated with often via e-mail prior to the trip. The hotel is set away from all the busy streets and a nice vigorous walk up a hill to the cental part of the old town with restaurants nearby. The buffet is ample and the staff were very helpful with cabs a five minute phone call away. I highly recommend this little hotel.l

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & beuaty rooms”
Reviews.Author: jdrigory
Reviews.Content: if you wanna visit Historical Ottoman & byzantium buildings, Excellent location in istanbul. near of blue mostque, and 10-20 minutes in Ayasofia, Sultanahmet. Staff is pretty and helpfull, and rooms very clear. Rooms pay is unexpensive more than europan hotels. I' havent car, i can't say anything about parking zones and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel good sataff nice location”
Reviews.Author: eliza7575
Reviews.Content: I wish every city had a hotel this perfect. The service was amazing!Would certainy stay there again, no need to try to "do better".he rooms were clean and recently updated. Overall this was a great value and its location can not be beat

Reviews.Title: “Neat, beatifully decorated hotel with sea view”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWW
Reviews.Content: Diva's is a neat, beautifully decorated hotel where the top floors have a great sea view. The hotel is well placed within walking distance of Istanbul's main attractions. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and decorated in local style. Breakfast is ok, though not one of the main reasons to choose Diva's. Recommended for travellers wishing to live in style close to the center of Istanbul's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting experience!”
Reviews.Author: Veve_33
Reviews.Content: We went on this trip without any expectations. We heard so many things about Istanbul (different opinions, from fantastic to crowdie and smelly, from wonderful to disaster) that we have decided not to consider any and just to enjoy every moment and every single new experience. But because we are talking about hotels â€¦ Divas Hotel is a 3* hotel, very well located (close to St. Sofia mosque and Blue mosque) in the â€œoldâ€� part of the town. It is a clean and nice little hotel, not noisy (unless you have an issue with the Islamic religious calling for praying time). The service was ok and the hotel personal helpful (they were not very familiar with English language but they were doing their best to help us). The breakfast was great â€“ if you (like me) donâ€™t mind to have only cheese â€œcombinationsâ€� (cheese, milk, yogurt, cheese tart, cheese pie or some cheese pastry). If I would have to think about minuses, I would say that I have never seen in my life such a small room and bed (considering that we had a double room). And I would also have to consider the fact that for one full day we had no water (for shower or toilet) â€¦ But generally it was very interesting. So I would definitely recommend everybody to go, at least once in a life time, to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable-nice staff-good location-immaculately clean”
Reviews.Author: Turkey8484
Reviews.Content: I originally had planned to stay for 3 nights-- but then extended my stay for the entire period I spent in Istanbul - 8 days. The Divas Hotel is intimate and small - NOT the type of an international chain hotel. The location is in walking distance to most important sites, the staff are welcoming and helpful, my chamber maid was a treasure (Turkish mama-type: efficient/smiling/cuddly!), try and book Room 504 (twin-beds) witha balcony and a wonderful view of the harbour and a local mosque (remember: 1st call from the minaret at 4.30AM!), the beds were excellent, the linen superb, the shower/loo in excellent condtion and modern - all in all a pleasure to stay here! Highy recommend it. The breakfast buffet was good but after a few days a little boring - could have done with a few changes of food/fruit/juices. But to sit in the garden and have it there - A PLEASURE! Hope the Divas will stay like this for years to come - because I will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel with very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: connaisseur78
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near to the Blue Mosque, even though the street next doors look a bit shanty by night. the hotel seems to be new. They gave us a big nice room with one double bed and one single bed. very nice deco and cleanliness is perfect. Staff is very nice and helpful, especially at the breakfast. Little minus point, our room was above the breakfast terrasse, therefore it was very loud. But overall very satisfied for a great rate of 60â‚¬ a night

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay at the Diva's Hotel and I recommend it to everyone who visits Istanbul for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: aditzu86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for those who want to visit the old part of Istanbul and don't need the confort of a 4/5star hotel. Service: The staff was really helpful and kind. Most of them speak english at an acceptable level. You can ask them for directions or any kind of advice you may need and they will do their best to help (restaurants, transportation, shopping, city tours). The room: like all the hotels in old Istanbul, this one is really small, but the rooms have all that 2 persons may need: confortable bed, cable tv, small bar, safebox. The only drawbacks were the bad smell from the bathroom and the noise from outside (cars, children screaming and prayers). The room was cleaned everyday and the towels were changed. Location: the hotel si hard to find even by taxi drivers. At first sight, the look of the area doesn't make you feel very safe, but once you get used to it, you'll realize that there are lot of other hotels and tourists nearby and it's safe even at night. It's 5-10 minutes walk from Sultanahmet Square, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, 10 minutes from Grand Bazaar and the tram that can take you to Galata Bridge in no time. The hotel has no restaurant, only buffet breakfast and a small terrace in the back where you can have a beer. There are no restaurants nearby, but in 10 minutes you can get to the tourist area where there are plenty of choices. I stayed here in June2010, when the rooftop terrace was not ready, but they said it would be done during the summer. Conclusion: Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “very bad to if your traveling with kids: no kitchen, no window...”
Reviews.Author: moniAdana
Reviews.Content: We paid a triple room and all we got was a double bed with no windows, funny smell, no kitchen. The personel was nice and helpfull but DO NOT BUY ANY BOAT TRIP FROM THEM if you don't want to be RIPPED OFF! They give you nice prices in euros, but they will only accept lyras at their own rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pinkie30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May. When we arrived we were told that we would be the first to stay in the new wing of the hotel. It was newly refurbished. There were a few teething problems but the staff sorted them out. The room was clean. the fixtures were cheap and cheerful but adequate. There was wifi available which worked most of the time. The breakfast was basic and the same every day. The only issue was the noise, as there were marble floors on the hallways and stairs you could hear lots of noise and when someone closes a door it echos. You could also hear the prayer calling at 5am but i think thats part and parcel of staying in Istanbul. We got delayed an extra night because of the ash cloud and they didnt have a room for us so we moved to the blue hills hotel up the road. Much nicer and actually was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Divas hotel in Istanbul, lovely hotel, great location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kas45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days. Great location in the heart of Old Istanbul, near Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. Easy to walk to many excellent local restaurants or to catch the street car. Our room with balcony was small but very clean and comfortable and the view from the balcony was fabulous. The staff were very very friendly and helpful. I hope to return to Divas Hotel soon. Note: this area of Istanbul is very hilly, so you need to be in shape to walk the hills. However, taking a taxi anywhere is easy and not expensive. Again, the staff can help with this.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT OCEAN VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: fenerim63
Reviews.Content: I loved the stay at this hotel. The people were through out welcoming and warm. I felt as if I was at home. I travel a lot so the hotel I stay at has a huge effect. I came to this hotel with my family and cleanliness is very important for me. The hotel was miraculously clean! It was beautiful. The views were amazing, the staff was just so caring. I enjoyed the stay at this hotel and highly recommend you to stay at it also. Everything is 100% at your fingertips in seconds. Safe, convenient, clean and warming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Single Room”
Reviews.Author: bronxmerline
Reviews.Content: I had so many problems getting from Cairo to Istanbul and from the Cairo airport to the hotel. But all was forgotten when I got to my room on the sixth floor overlooking the Marmara Sea and the beautiful mosque directly below my window. I looked forward to getting "home" to my view each night. Breakfast was very good. Staff was very helpful. The tours they recommended were just right for getting an overview of the major sights. As long as I sat near my door the internet connection was fine. Three blocks from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and close to Topkopi. I'd happily stay there again. Just be sure to carry the hotel phone number with you. If you have any mixup about pick-up, airport hotel help desk will call for you (but only if you have the number to give them).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tizy1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at this hotel in the heart of historical Istanbul and I can eulogize its features: -Convenient base for visiting the beauties of this wonderful city -Brand new hotel completely restored -Tastefully-furnished rooms -Friendly and skilled staff -Breakfast acceptablle even by Italian standards -Very attractive price. I recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the center of Sultanameth spending, say, less than fair.

Reviews.Title: “When in Istanbul, NEVER come to this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: antoniofoglia529
Reviews.Content: I am not the sort of person that often feels compelled to write comments on such sites (this is my first time), but I feel that I have to on this occasion in order to make others aware of what they can expect from this disgraceful establishment. My experience at this hotel has been a nightmare from start to finish...in fact they are still making my life miserable, and I got HOME yesterday! The positives of this hotel are that one or two (literally!) of the staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms, although small, are nicely furnished; and its fairly well located in close proximity to the major tourist sights. HOWEVER from the moment I arrived I have felt like I have had to fight and argue in order to get what I had paid for and not to be ripped off. Upon arrival we were told that the double sea view room we had booked from the UK was unavailable as they were fully booked (?!) and told me to enquire the following morning with regards to being moved for the remaning nights. In the mean time they put us into a twin room which was actually below ground level, which I accepted as I guessed that little could be done at this point, despite the fact that this was next door to a very noisy lift and above the kitchen and breakfast restaurant which meant that it was also extremely difficult to sleep. The following morning the guy at reception told me that all would be sorted by his colleague when I returned from my tour later on in the day. I told the guy at reception I was expecting a tour guide to pick us up (booked from the UK) after showing him my booking slip and asked for him to give me a call when they arrived. Soon after the call came to say he had arrived, and suspicious of the fact that the company I booked through didnt match that on the guide's shirt. I was assured that they were the same company. Still suspicious however and by this time on the coach, I asked the guide to confirm which tour this was for... surprise, surprise this was a different tour with a different company for a higher price than my booking. I was extremely upset with the hotel for knowingly trying to put me on a tour which I hadnt booked (no doubt affiliated with the hotel), and demanded that they call my tour guide to arrange a pick up. The hotel manager was shockingly rude, and seemed to want to get into an argument with me. Famous Turkish hospitality (which I can generally vouch for having visited the country before) is NOT present at this place. After I had been on my planned tour, I spoke to a new guy at the desk about my room change. Again surprise, surprise he knew nothing about this and actually had the cheek to ask why I hadnt asked sooner after I had been told by his colleague that he would have it sorted. After much arguing, miraculously a double sea view room became available. As part of my booking at this hotel (through a very well known website famous for bookings at the last minute) there was also an offer of a free one-way airport transfer. When I consulted the hotel about this on the day before I was due to leave, they said that this only applied to Ataturk airport and not Sabiha Gokcen. This was obviously stated no-where on the booking, and that they would only give me a discount. By this point I had completely lost the will to argue anymore and I glumly accepted to pay whatever it was to get me out of there. Now back in the UK, I was woken this morning by a phone call from the hotel manager stating that a tea cup has been taken from the room and that either I pay them (either Â£15 or Â£50, I couldnt make it out) her directly for this, or they will contact my agent and get them to charge me. This is, of course, complete rubbish and I am very annoyed and concerned with the prospect of them charging me for something I havent done. Please do not trust the staff at this hotel, and this is without even mentioning the disturbances caused by the renovations taking place...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for All The Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: LlamaFarmer66
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was on the whole very good. The staff were very welcoming and helpful in everything we asked for or wanted to know. Our rooms were brand new in the new part of the hotel and had never been used before! There were a few teething problems, but nothing that couldnt be put right. In my opinion the rooms could be further improved with simple additions, such as a waste bin in the bedroom, drawers for clothes, 2 bedside cabinets (instead of one). The decor chosen is really nice and a bit different from the bog standard hotel rooms. Beds super comfortable. Walls are a bit thin and could hear bathroom activities of rooms next door and below! Floors are laminate so sounds carry a bit but bearing in mind we spent little time in the rooms, this didnt present a problem. Sea view was correct, but a bit of a over statement. Stayed on B&B terms and a little more choice on the breakfast buffet might be nice? But not too much to push the prices up. Location couldnt be better, walking distance to the Blue Mosque and other attractions. Very good value for money. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul and when the renovation work is finished it will be a stunning little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: generalscreenname
Reviews.Content: Divas Hotel is amazing. Everyone is so friendly and helpful! The location is prime spot for all sight-seeing in Istanbul. I recommend a sea view room because you will not regret it! The sunsets I watched from my balcony were some of the most beautiful sunsets I've ever seen. The next time I visit Istanbul I will stay at the Divas Hotel again without a doubt. It's location is literally within walking distance from everything (except the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable, clean, quiet and perfect lacation.”
Reviews.Author: kretaberit
Reviews.Content: We had five splendid days in Istanbul. Staying at Divas hotel made it very easy to travel around. The hotel was a surprice considering the low cost. Nicely decorated, nice room, good beds, beatiful view from the balcony, hospitable and helpful staff, a good breakfast. No problems what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , clean comfortable hotel , friendly and pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: DeltaNeal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Divas in early March for three nights , apparently Hotel Divas had changed locations from a couple of blocks away and the new building was very nice. My room was on the sixth floor overlooking the Bosporus , it was clean and well kept, the bed was probably the most comfortable I've had in a hotel , the bathroom shower water was hot and had excellent pressure. The staff were very accomodating and helpful , particularly the young man who attended the breakfast room . The manager Sidar spoke excellent english and was quite efficient. I would recommend this hotel to guests looking for good value at a moderate rate.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a super area”
Reviews.Author: MissInge
Reviews.Content: Me a my friend decided to stay for 10 days at hotel Diva;s. Because of the heavy rain we were relocated at another hotel for one night. Everything was perfectly arranged. When we came the second day, we were kindly greeted and brought to our room. The room was very nice. Clean and nicely decorated. We absolutely loved it. When we needed something the workers made sure we got it within one phonecall. Also, we got clean towels and every day and clean bedsheets every other day. The lacation is great. From Diva's you only walk a few minutes to the streettrain, numerous restaurants and 10 minutes to the Hagia Sophia and Sultan Ahmetmosque (blue mosque). Diva's is located on a quiet street, near the lively streets of the Sultanahmetarea. The breakfast was very good, but plain. All we needed. It was a great experience to stay at this hotel and we are planning another trip back to Diva's.
